thread.title: Vehicle crashes into Mardi Gras parade crowd in New Orleans
thread.title_full: Vehicle crashes into Mardi Gras parade crowd in New Orleans

author: Rachel Olding
title: Vehicle crashes into Mardi Gras parade crowd in New Orleans
text:
twitter TWEET More 
Police say 12 people have been serious injured when a vehicle ploughed into a crowd watching the Krewe of Endymion parade to celebrate Mardi Gras in the US city of New Orleans. 
The Times-Picayune reports the crash happened on Saturday about 6.45pm, local time. 
The driver was drunk and up to 21 people have sustained injuries, New Orleans Mayor Mitch Landrieu said. 
New Orleans Police Department spokeswoman Ambria Washington says that "initial reports show so far that about a dozen people are in critical condition". 
She says that number could increase as the investigation continues. 
The Krewe of Endymion is the largest of 80 parades held during the New Orleans Mardi Gras. #BREAKING : A driver just plowed into a large crowd of people at a #NewOrleans parade, at least 12 critically injured pic.twitter.com/WBd29vArrn — Lucid Hurricane™✘ (@Lucid4Trump) February 26, 2017 
AP
